resources.string: 30 Days App
Draw something using only 3 colors you wouldn’t normally pick.
Sketch your breakfast, no matter how messy it is.
Spend 10 minutes making random marks — don’t aim for a finished piece.
Redraw a childhood drawing with your current skills.
Pick an object nearby and draw it from 3 different angles.
Create something entirely in silhouette form (just shapes, no details).
Listen to a song and draw what it feels like.
Use a timer — 5 minutes for a sketch, then stop. Repeat with new ideas.
Try drawing with your non-dominant hand.
Pick a random word from a book and illustrate it.
Fill a page with only one type of texture or pattern.
Combine two animals into one creature.
Draw a scene using only straight lines.
Redesign a character from your favorite movie or game.
Make a comic strip with only 3 panels.
Sketch in total darkness (don’t peek until you’re done).
Paint or draw something entirely in shades of one color.
Do a “draw your day” journal entry.
Take a photo you like and turn it into a simplified line drawing.
Pick a random household object and turn it into a fantasy weapon or gadget.
Draw a famous landmark without looking at a reference — from memory.
Start with a scribble, then turn it into a creature or character.
Only draw with circles — no other shapes allowed.
Doodle on top of a printed-out photo.
Recreate a famous artwork in your own style.
Sketch an object at extreme zoom (just a small detail of it).
Make a collage of random shapes, then trace over it.
Draw yourself as if you lived in a different time period.
Create an artwork using only one continuous line.
Choose your favorite from the month and make a polished, final version.
